did.abstract: Materials in this collection include wage-hour expenditures, allocations, employee lists, policies, brochures, reports, and correspondence. They range in date from 1964 to 1989.

prefercite.head: Preferred citation
prefercite.p: Gelman Library Office of Student Employment records, Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: Series 1 is closed to research for 25 years from date of record creation.. Series 2 is closed to research for 50 years from date of record creation.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Materials were transferred to the University Archives by the Gelman Library Human Resources Office.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Some material may be copyrighted or restricted. It is the patron's obligation to determine and satisfy copyright or other case restrictions when publishing or otherwise distributing materials found in the collections.

bioghist.head: Historical or Biographical Note
bioghist.p: The Student Employment office is now called Human Resources, is under the Assistant University Librarian for Administration, Development, and Personnel. The office oversees both graded and wage hour employees, including students. Its mission is to promote a work environment characterized by fair and equitable treatment of staff, effective recruitment, quality customer care, personal acceptability, trust and mutual respect.

The George Washington University's (GW) Melvin Gelman Library opened in 1973. Before the Gelman Library (which received its current name in 1980), the University Library was located in Lisner Hall, formerly Lisner Library. When the University moved to Foggy Bottom in 1912 from its location on 15th and H Streets, N.W., the first library was located in the original Lisner Hall, the former St. Rose's School for Orphaned Girls, between 20th and 21st Streets on G Street. Other libraries include the Virginia Campus Library (established in 1990), and the Mount Vernon Campus Eckles Library (under GW control since 1997). Together, these three libraries form the Gelman Library System (GLS).

The Library is headed by a University Librarian, who oversees: the Assistant University Librarian for Administration, Development, and Personnel; Associate University Librarian for Collections Services; Associate University Librarian for Information Technology; Associate University Librarian for Public Services; Directors of the Mt. Vernon and Virginia Campus libraries, and the Manager of GLS Financial Operations.
N.B. This history note was written in 2005

scopecontent.head: Collection Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Materials in this collection include wage-hour expenditures, allocations, employee lists, policies, brochures, reports, and correspondence. They range in date from 1964 to 1989, and were transferred to the University Archives by the Gelman Library Human Resources Office.

arrangement.head: Collection Organization
arrangement.p: Organized into two series: two series of Office files.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This series is a collection of wage-hour expenditures/allocations and employee lists. They range in date from 1964 to 1989.
This series has a paper container list in the reading room, please ask staff for assistance.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This series is a collection of personnel and payroll policies, brochures, reports, correspondence, and student employment records. They range in date from 1981 to 1989.
This series has a paper container list in the reading room, please ask staff for assistance.
